key_points: Tom Brady has experienced numerous memorable moments during his 21-year NFL career.
Brady revealed his favorite NFL moment on the "Let's Go!" podcast, co-hosted by Jim Gray.
His favorite moment was the New England Patriots' 28-24 victory over the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl XLIX.
Brady chose this moment due to the significant time gap between his third and fourth Super Bowl wins.
He highlighted the difficulty of winning Super Bowls, having lost two finals between his third and fourth victories.
The win against the Seahawks was marked by Malcolm Butler's famous last-minute interception.
Brady was not on the field for the play he considers his favorite moment, noting his focus is on winning rather than personal stats.
After winning MVP of Super Bowl XLIX, Brady gifted his prize, a truck, to Malcolm Butler.
Brady has won 236 regular season games, 34 postseason games, and seven Super Bowls in his career.
Despite numerous achievements, Brady cherishes the Patriots' win over the Seahawks above all.
